'''Cottalango Leon''' (born 1971)<ref name="PSG">[http://psgtech.edu/oscaralum.php Alum Profile. (2016).] Mr. Cottalango(1992 BE-CSE), an Alumnus of PSG College of Technology getting Award from OSCAR Academy. [[PSG College of Technology]]. Retrieved 12 February 2016.</ref> is an Indian-American [[computer graphics]] technician who won the [[Academy Award]] for [[Academy Scientific and Technical Award|scientific and technical achievement]] jointly with Sam Richards and J. Robert Ray in 2016.<ref name="Hindu">[http://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/techie-born-in-tn-wins-academy-award/article8155120.ece News. (2016).] Techie, born in T.N., wins Academy Award. M. Soundarya Preetha. ''[[The Hindu]]''. Retrieved 8 Feb 2016.</ref><ref name="Oscar">[http://www.oscars.org/news/11-scientific-and-technical-achievements-be-honored-academy-awardsr Official Awards Notification. (2016).] 11 Scientific and technical achievements to be honoured with Academy Awards. ''[[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]]''. Retrieved 8 February 2016.</ref>
Leon won the Academy Award for "the design, engineering and continuous development"{{efn|name=fn1|''As per the Academy's official notification''.}} of [[Sony Pictures Imageworks]] itView technology, a [[digital media|digital]] [[3D film|3D]] film review [[software]].<ref name="Oscar"/><ref name="Sony">[http://library.imageworks.com/pdfs/imageworks-library-Surfs-Up-the-making-of-an-animated-documentary.pdf Imageworks Library (2007).] itView annotation tools (3.6.3.4). Sony Pictures Animation, Inc. ''Surf's Up: The making of an animated documentary''. Retrieved 10 February 2016.</ref><ref name="Variety">[http://variety.com/2016/film/news/2016-academy-sci-tech-awards-winners-1201675428/ News. (2016).] Academy Honors 33 Individuals With Scientific and Technical Awards. Dave McNary, Film Reporter. ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]''. Retrieved 8 February 2016.</ref> Leon worked on the itView technology for eight years as the chief contributor.<ref name="NDTV"/>
Schooled in India, Leon is an [[Arizona State University]] alumnus.<ref name="PSG"/> He has worked at Sony Pictures Imageworks since 1996, and has contributed to the making of several commercially successful films, including the ''[[Spider-Man in film#Sam Raimi films (2002-07)|Spider-Man film series]]'' and the ''[[Men in Black (film series)|Men In Black film series]]''.<ref name="Toi2"/>
==Early life and family== Leon was born at his mother's family residence in [[Thoothukudi]], [[Tamil Nadu]] in 1971.<ref name="PSG"/><ref name="Hindu"/> Both his parents – mother Rajam Mariasingam and father Loorthu – were primary school teachers. When Leon was young, his parents moved from the south of [[Tamil Nadu]] to [[Coimbatore]].<ref name="PSG"/><ref name="Toi2">[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/english/hollywood/news/Of-Indian-origin-Oscar-winner-Cottalango-Leon-says-opportunities-in-India-are-better-than-ever/articleshow/50717296.cms Interview. (2016).] Of Indian origin, Oscar winner Cottalango Leon says opportunities in India are better than ever. Keyur Seta. Times News Network. ''[[The Times of India]]''. Retrieved 9 February 2016.</ref><ref name="NDTV">[http://www.ndtv.com/indians-abroad/indian-origin-technician-cottalango-leon-wins-oscar-1269117 Indians Abroad News. (2016).] Indian-Origin Technician Cottalango Leon Wins Oscar. J Sam Daniel Stalin. ''[[NDTV]]''. Retrieved 8 February 2016.</ref> Leon's early years were spent in this city – a place he still visits every two years.<ref name="Hindu"/><ref name="NewIndianExpress">[http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/tamil/Tamilian-Wins-Oscar-for-Science-and-Technology/2016/02/01/article3254799.ece Entertainment News. (2016).] Tamilian Wins Oscar for Science and Technology. Anushree Madhavan. ''[[The New Indian Express]]''. Retrieved 9 February 2016.</ref>
Leon attended the Government High School at Kallapalayam, a village in the [[Sultanpet Block]] of Coimbatore.<ref>[http://tnmaps.tn.nic.in/blks_info.php?dcode=12&blk_name=Sultanpet&dcodenew=11&drdblknew=18 Government map. (undated).] Taluk Information. Coimbatore: Sultanpet Block. TWAD Board. ''[[Government of Tamil Nadu]] maps''. Retrieved 10 February 2016.</ref> After studying here till grade VII, he studied from grade VIII to grade XII at Kadri Mills High School in Coimbatore.<ref name="Hindu2">[http://www.thehindu.com/life-and-style/youth/the-famous-five/article4290788.ece News. (2013).] The famous five. Akila Kannadasan. ''[[The Hindu]]''. Retrieved 10 February 2016.</ref><ref name="Jagran">[http://www.jagranjosh.com/current-affairs/cottalango-leon-selected-for-2016-technical-achievement-award-of-academy-of-motion-pictures-1453881856-1 Current Affairs. (2016).] Cottalango Leon selected for 2016 Technical Achievement Award of Academy of Motion Pictures. ''Jagran Josh''. Retrieved 9 February 2016.</ref> During his childhood, Leon became interested in the subjects of [[mathematics]] and [[science]], and also developed, as per him, a keen interest in "the visual aspect of movies".<ref name="Toi2"/> Subsequently, Leon attended college at the [[PSG College of Technology]] from 1988 till 1992, completing his [[Bachelors of Engineering]] degree in [[computer science]].<ref name="Hindu"/> He completed his [[List of master's degrees in North America#Computer science|M.S]] in computer science from [[Arizona State University]] in 1996, specialising in [[computer graphics]].<ref name="PSG"/>
Leon married Roopa in 2001. Roopa also belongs to southern Tamil Nadu, having lived there till her marriage to Leon.<ref name="Toi2"/> The couple have a daughter Shruthi and live in Culver City.<ref name="Toi2"/><ref name="NDTV"/><ref name="Toi1">[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/english/hollywood/news/Cottalango-Leon-another-Indian-origin-technician-wins-Oscar/articleshow/50681522.cms News. (2016).] Cottalango Leon, another Indian-origin technician, wins Oscar. Keyur Seta. Times News Network. ''[[The Times of India]]''. Retrieved 8 February 2016.</ref>
==Career== [[File:HotelTransylvania.jpg|thumb|''[[Hotel Transylvania]]'', a [[3-D film|3D]] computer animated fantasy [[comedy film]] produced by [[Sony Pictures Animation]] in 2012, is one of the movies Leon has been notably associated with]] After graduating, Leon joined the [[New Delhi]] firm Softek LLC and worked with them for two years till 1994.<ref name="Toi2"/> As per Leon, during this time, he became inspired by ''[[Jurassic Park (film)|Jurassic Park]]'' after watching the film and decided to pursue his career in the technologies used in its making.<ref name="Toi2"/> After completing the master's degree at Arizona State University in 1996, Leon worked for a short time as a [[game programmer]] with [[DreamWorks Interactive]], before joining Sony Pictures Imageworks in 1996, where he continues working to date, currently holding the position of [[Software engineer|Principal Software Engineer]].<ref name="PSG"/><ref name="Toi2"/>
At Imageworks, as per Leon, he was asked to develop an improved digital film review software as an alternative to a then existing software.<ref name="Toi2"/> Leon released the initial version within two months of having been assigned the job; after receiving positive feedback from the artists using the software, Leon kept updating various functionalities of the software over the years.<ref name="Toi2"/> This digital [[3D film|3D]] film review software, itView, led Leon to get an [[Cottalango Leon#2016 Academy Award|Academy Award in 2016]]. Leon mentions working alone on the project for many years, and that he was over time given a team when the project achieved significant growth.<ref name="Toi2"/> In a 2016 media interview, Leon says that he worked on the itView technology for eight years as the chief contributor.<ref name="NDTV"/>
To date, Leon has worked on several commercially successful films, including ''[[Stuart Little (film)|Stuart Little]]'', the ''[[Spider-Man in film#Sam Raimi films (2002-07)|Spider-Man film series]]'', the ''[[Men in Black (film series)|Men In Black film series]]'', ''[[Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs (film)|Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs]]'', ''[[The Smurfs (film)|The Smurfs]]'', ''[[Hotel Transylvania]]'', and ''[[Open Season (2006 film)|Open Season]]''.<ref name="Toi2"/>
==2016 Academy Award== Leon, at the age of 44, won the 2016 Academy Award for scientific and technical achievement for "the design, engineering and continuous development"{{efn|name=fn1}} of [[Sony Pictures Imageworks]] itView technology.<ref name="Oscar"/><ref name="Sony"/><ref name="Toi2"/> In a ceremony held on 13 February 2016 at [[Beverly Wilshire Hotel]] in [[Beverly Hills, California]], Leon received the Academy Award jointly with Sam Richards and J. Robert Ray.<ref name="Toi3">[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/english/hollywood/news/WATCH-Rahul-C-Thakkar-and-Cottalango-Leon-who-are-of-Indian-origin-given-Oscar-Technical-Achievement-awards/articleshow/50990316.cms Entertainment News. (2016).] WATCH: Rahul C. Thakkar and Cottalango Leon, who are of Indian origin, given Oscar Technical Achievement awards. Dominic Ferrao and Keyur Seta. ''Times News Network, [[The Times of India]]''. Retrieved 16 February 2016.</ref> As per the Academy, these set of awards are bestowed upon individuals who have contributed significantly over time – and not necessarily in the past year – to the [[motion picture]] industry.<ref name="Oscar"/>
[[Richard Edlund]], Chair of the Scientific and Technical Awards Committee at the [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]] praised the "outstanding, innovative work" of awardees, adding that their contributions "have further expanded filmmakers’ creative opportunities...” The Academy's award citation praised itView's [[API]] [[Plug-in (computing)|plugin]] and varied functionalities, mentioning that "itView provides an intuitive and flexible creative review environment that can be deployed globally for highly efficient collaboration."<ref name="Oscar"/> Leon said that "the award was not totally unexpected" but that it felt "good to be recognised by the Academy and the wider industry."<ref name="Hindu"/>
